description: Hugo & LÃ©a act as requirements engineers for this project.
Native macOS development with Universal Binary support (Apple Silicon/Intel).
Swift/SwiftUI usage for a lightweight footprint without external dependencies.
Key concepts definition: Sequential Copying and Floating Pins.
Integration via Menu Bar icon, System Shelf, and Background Agent.
Support for macOS 12.0+ and Accessibility/Screen Recording permissions.
Global hotkeys must function across QWERTY, AZERTY, and QWERTZ layouts.
Target active RAM consumption between 100MB and 300MB.
Transform the volatile system clipboard into a structured and searchable workspace.
Elimination of context-switching and reduction of cognitive load.
Handling of Text, Code, Media, Files, and Links with metadata.
Local-only storage: no cloud synchronization of data.
No support for Right-to-Left (RTL) languages at launch.
No support for third-party plugins or extensions at launch.
Target users: developers, writers, and researchers.
Horizontal "Shelf" interface limited to 35% of screen height.
Card-based history list featuring source application icons.
Smart preview pane (code rendering, images, rich links).
Real-time multi-parameter search and filtering by tags.
Full CRUD lifecycle for tags with protection against auto-purge.
Temporary FIFO stack for Sequential Copying (CMD+SHIFT+C).
Detachable, resizable "Floating Pins" windows that stay Always-on-Top.
Deep Awareness integration with browsers, IDEs, and design tools.
Instantaneous response times: Capture <10ms, Search <100ms, UI <150ms.
AES-256 encryption at rest and exclusion of concealed sensitive data.
Local backup system via daily snapshots and manual export.
